questions.question: When developing a Unique Value Proposition (UVP) for your sleep coaching practice, which element is most critical for market positioning?
options: Listing every certification you have earned in chronological order
Offering the lowest price in your local geographic area
Clearly defining the specific transformation your S.L.U.M.B.E.R. Method™ provides for a specific niche
Using as many technical medical terms as possible to establish authority
questions.explanation: A strong UVP focuses on the specific transformation and benefits provided to a target niche, rather than just credentials or price.

questions.question: A client's child is exhibiting signs of obstructive sleep apnea (snoring and gasping). According to the Scope of Practice guidelines in Lesson 2, what is the coach's legal obligation?
options: Suggest a specific pillow to keep the child's airway open
Immediately refer the client to a pediatrician or ENT for medical evaluation
Adjust the S.L.U.M.B.E.R. Method™ to include more upright sleep positions
Wait two weeks to see if the symptoms resolve with better sleep hygiene
questions.explanation: Sleep coaches are non-medical professionals; any red flags like apnea must be referred to a medical professional immediately to stay within the legal scope of practice.

questions.question: In Lesson 3, 'Anchor Pricing' is recommended when packaging services. How is this strategy effectively implemented?
options: Starting with your lowest-priced service to get the client's foot in the door
Charging a flat hourly rate for all services regardless of complexity
Presenting a high-value 'Premium' package first to set a price ceiling and make mid-tier packages more attractive
Allowing the client to name their own price based on their budget
questions.explanation: Anchor pricing involves presenting the most expensive/comprehensive option first, which serves as a psychological reference point for the value of other packages.

questions.question: According to Lesson 4, which 'Strategic Partnership' typically yields the highest conversion rate for new leads?
options: Purchasing targeted Facebook and Instagram advertisements
Partnering with local pediatricians who can provide direct referrals
Distributing flyers at local grocery stores and parks
Joining generic 'business networking' groups with no parenting focus
questions.explanation: Pediatricians are high-trust partners; a referral from a doctor bridges the 'trust gap' and results in significantly higher conversion rates than cold advertising.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the 'Discovery Call' in the Onboarding Workflow (Lesson 5)?
options: To provide the full sleep plan and start training immediately
To collect payment and sign the legal contract on the spot
To assess the client's readiness, ensure a good personality fit, and confirm the case is within your scope
To diagnose medical sleep disorders
questions.explanation: The discovery call is a qualifying tool to ensure the coach and client are a good match and that the coach can actually help the client's specific situation.

questions.question: Lesson 6 discusses the 'Golden Window' for requesting testimonials. When is the most effective time to ask a client for a review?
options: During the very first discovery call
3 to 7 days after the successful conclusion of the sleep plan
Six months after the service is completed to check for long-term results
Only if the client complains about the price
questions.explanation: The 'Golden Window' is shortly after success is achieved, when the client's 'emotional ROI' is highest and the transformation is most fresh in their mind.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an 'Ethical Dual Relationship' boundary violation in a sleep coaching practice?
options: Providing a sleep plan to a paying client you met through an ad
Charging a higher fee for weekend support hours
Entering into a deep personal friendship or secondary business venture with a current active client
Referring a client to a lactation consultant
questions.explanation: Dual relationships (being a coach and a close friend/business partner simultaneously) can cloud professional judgment and are discouraged in professional ethics.

questions.question: When scaling a practice to include 'Passive Income' (Lesson 8), which model allows for the greatest leverage of a coach's time?
options: Increasing the number of 1-on-1 private consultations per week
Offering 24/7 text support to all clients
Developing and selling a self-paced digital course based on the S.L.U.M.B.E.R. Method™
Traveling to clients' homes for overnight stays
questions.explanation: Digital products allow a coach to serve an unlimited number of people without trading more of their limited hours for dollars.

questions.question: Why is 'Errors and Omissions' (E&O) insurance critical for a Child Sleep Coach?
options: It is required by law in every single country and territory
It covers the coach in the event a client claims the advice provided caused harm or failed to produce results
It pays for the coach's health insurance and retirement
It guarantees that every baby will sleep through the night
questions.explanation: E&O insurance (Professional Liability) protects the coach against claims of negligence or mistakes made during the course of professional service.

questions.question: In Lesson 7, what is the 'Professional Standard' regarding client confidentiality?
options: Coaches may share client names and photos on social media without permission if the baby is cute
Coaches must maintain strict confidentiality, only sharing case details if they have written consent or for anonymous professional supervision
Confidentiality only applies to the child, not the parents
All client data should be stored in public Google Docs for transparency
questions.explanation: Professionalism requires strict adherence to privacy; written consent is mandatory before using any client information for marketing or public purposes.
